name: Fish Oil
summary: Fish oil is a rich source of omega-3 fatty acids, primarily EPA (eicosapentaenoic acid) and DHA (docosahexaenoic acid), widely studied for cardiovascular, cognitive, and mood-related benefits.
description: Fish oil is derived from the tissues of oily fish such as salmon, mackerel, and sardines. It contains the omega-3 fatty acids EPA and DHA, which are integral to cell membrane function, anti-inflammatory pathways, and brain health. Fish oil is one of the most extensively researched dietary supplements, with evidence supporting its role in cardiovascular disease prevention, lowering triglycerides, and adjunctive therapy in mood disorders like depression. It is also commonly used for cognitive support, inflammatory conditions, and general wellness.

metadata.natural_source: Marine fish oils (salmon, mackerel, sardines, anchovies)
metadata.fda_status: Dietary supplement; prescription forms FDA-approved for hypertriglyceridemia

sections.text: Fish oil provides omega-3 fatty acids EPA and DHA, which incorporate into cell membranes, influence membrane fluidity, and modulate gene expression. They reduce inflammatory eicosanoids, cytokines, and triglyceride synthesis. In the brain, they support synaptic plasticity, neurotransmission, and neuroprotection.

adult.typical: 1000–3000 mg of combined EPA + DHA per day
adult.note: For triglyceride lowering, Rx doses of 2–4 g/day are commonly prescribed.

sections.pediatric: Consult a pediatrician; lower doses based on weight may be appropriate.

sections.text: Lipid changes may be observed after 2–3 months; mood and cognitive effects may take several weeks of consistent use.

serious: Increased bleeding risk at high doses
Rare atrial fibrillation risk at very high doses

other: Caution in patients on anticoagulant or antiplatelet therapy.
High doses may increase risk of atrial fibrillation in susceptible populations.

sections.pregnancy: Generally safe; DHA is beneficial for fetal brain development
sections.lactation: Safe; may improve infant neurodevelopment outcomes
sections.geriatrics: Safe; useful for cardiovascular and cognitive health

sections.text: No tapering required; may discontinue without withdrawal effects.

items: Prescription-strength formulations are used for hypertriglyceridemia; OTC products vary in purity and EPA/DHA content.
EPA appears more relevant for mood disorders, while DHA is critical for neurodevelopment and cognition.
Enteric-coated capsules may reduce fishy aftertaste.

items.label: Grosso G, et al. Omega-3 fatty acids and depression. CNS Neurol Disord Drug Targets. 2014
